name: Hans
message: You guys again......
Koty, nothing good will come from getting involved with these people.

name: Cordelia
message: Is that a threat, Hans？

name: Hans
message: What would I possibly gain by threatening you?
I'm just giving you some advice.

name: Cordelia
message: Then just leave us alone.
I trust Jonathan and the professors.

name: Hans
message: ......Do whatever you want.

name: Hans
message: Huh, you guys are still in Arkham？
You should get out while you can, before you end up a mess.

name: Jonathan
message: You don't have to worry about us.
So far, we've managed to handle things somehow.

name: Hans
message: Well, that's good then... The one over there is...

name: Hans
message: Koty...
Hey you, what are you doing with these people？

name: Cordelia
message: What do you mean？
I'm just showing you around the village.

name: Hans
message: You... if someone from the village saw you like that！

name: Cordelia
message: どうなるって言うの？
I mean, it's not like I'm doing anything wrong, right?

name: Cordelia
message: These people don't know their way around the village, so I'm just showing them around for a bit, that's all.

name: Hans
message: If you do that, he’ll‥‥‥‥‥‥‥
Hans said that, then grimaced and shut his mouth.
I wonder who 'that person' is.
Is there someone in the village who doesn’t like that Cordelia and us are together？
There isn't really anything all that interesting, though......
It might be better to at least act like I'm thinking of buying something—the shopkeeper might like that.
The store is packed with a surprisingly large amount of products. Things like canned beans, Soup, cosmetics, and more are all jumbled together.
Most of it is just the common, cheap stuff you see anywhere, and since it doesn't look dusty, I guess the stock moves pretty well.

name: Hans
message: Hey, if you don't have any business here, can you go home？
If strangers are hanging around, it'll mess with the shop's business.
It's an old cash register I haven't seen in about 10 years. They probably don't find it inconvenient for now, but it seems like the owner of this place isn't the type to invest much in equipment.
But even so, the old machine actually seems to fit the vibe of the shop. Something this big and heavy would be a real pain to steal.
There's no doubt Hans is definitely hiding something.
But Cordelia should've become a villager way before that.
Are they saying that the newcomer Hans knows something that even Cordelia doesn't?
Hans is looking around at us with a troubled expression.
He seems to care about me and Gardner and the others too, but his main concern is apparently Cordelia, who's standing next to me.
Does this guy have a thing for Cordelia...?
No, it doesn't seem like that's all there is to it.
Isn't there some kind of connection between Cordelia being brought to this village and how flustered Hans is?
Hans is, as usual, looking sullen, and as if he doesn't want to make eye contact with us, he's absorbed in wiping imaginary dust off the Counter with a rag.
She has a sulky look on her face.
Could it be that Hans has feelings for Cordelia？
So are they saying they don't like us getting close to Cordelia? But then, what did Hans really mean by 'that person' earlier?
I can't just chalk it up as something he blurted out...

name: Hans
message: Do you have any other business here？
It's not like I have time to waste either, you know.

name: Cordelia
message: What on earth am I supposed to ask？
Cordelia whispered into my ear.
そうだな、ハンスから聞き出したい事と言えば‥‥‥‥
『The thing I was about to say earlier』
『店の前の主人の事』
『店の経営状態』

name: Hans
message: Hey, you.
Hans glared at me, his face tense.
He probably thinks he's being intimidating, but unfortunately, it looks like he's not nearly as much of a bad guy as he thinks he is.

name: Hans
message: You haven't been doing anything weird to Koty, have you?
If you do something like that, there's no way you'd be able to just leave the village that easily.

name: Cordelia
message: Who were you talking about earlier when you said 'that person'? Who is that?
Are you saying there's someone who gets mad whenever I do something？

name: Cordelia
message: Hans！

name: Hans
message: Hey... don't make such a scary face.
I didn't say anything like that.

name: Cordelia
message: No, I definitely said it.
"If you do that, that person will..."

name: Cordelia
message: Who are you talking about when you say 'that person'？
You’re not scared of the people from Arkham Village, are you？

name: Hans
message: The guys here are just cowards, you know.
Why the hell should I be scared of those guys？

name: Cordelia
message: Then who the hell is it, anyway?
You look totally pale.

name: Hans
message: Koty, aren't you and I both outsiders?
そんなにアーカムの事を嗅ぎ回って何の得になる。

name: Cordelia
message: You really don't know anything？
Who　the　hell　do　you　mean　by　'that　person'?

name: Hans
message: 村の人間がよく口にしてる事だ。
You really don't know how much the people in the village care about you, do you？

name: Cordelia
message: Me？
Are you saying the people in the village treat me especially precious？

name: Hans
message: Yeah, if it wasn't for that, you would've already been made a plaything a long time ago.

name: Hans
message: There's no way a girl who's just 15 or so could run a tavern all by herself, right？

name: Cordelia
message: No way......

name: Hans
message: You have no idea how many times I've tried to shove you into the Gilman House. I'm not as decent a guy as you think, Koty.

name: Hans
message: I don't remember at all what kind of person they were.
I just know that one day, they suddenly disappeared and that's it.

name: Cordelia
message: What was the name of the general store owner before you again？

name: Hans
message: Why do you want to know something like that？
First off, I came to the village after the shopkeeper disappeared, so isn’t it Koty who knows more about this than me?

name: Cordelia
message: そうね‥‥‥‥あの人、なんて名前だったかしら？
She wasn't exactly the memorable type...

name: Hans
message: I don't remember either.
I heard he was one of the people from this village, but one day he just suddenly disappeared.

name: Cordelia
message: Yeah, that's right‥‥‥‥
The owner of the general store disappeared too. Just like my adoptive parents.

name: Hans
message: I don't know why, but it seems like everyone in this village just disappears when they get old.

name: Hans
message: Nah, it’s not just old folks. The guy Hudson at the Fish Scale Inn works for should be just a bit over 30, I think.

name: Jonathan
message: What did you say？
So Hudson's husband disappeared too, huh.

name: Hans
message: I don't know what he's so upset about, but if I were that husband, there's no way I'd dump such a beautiful wife and disappear.

name: Jonathan
message: Why are you like that...

name: Hans
message: That's why I told you, people in this village tend to disappear a lot. Maybe the reason they let outsiders like us run the stores and inns is actually because of that.

name: Jonathan
message: Now that you mention it, it does feel like the villagers here disappear at a way higher rate compared to people from other areas.

name: Hans
message: 俺達よそ者に店やら宿やらを経営させるのも、案外それが　　　　　　原因かもしれんね。

name: Hans
message: I'm at least earning enough to feed myself.
No need to worry about me.

name: Cordelia
message: It doesn't look like there are many customers, but is business doing well？

name: Hans
message: I guess I'm not really cut out for business.
こうして毎日店を開けていても大した儲けになんないね。

name: Cordelia
message: It's the last shop in the village, so please try to keep it going somehow.

name: Hans
message: But you know, it seems like people in this village don't really need this kind of stuff all that much.

name: Cordelia
message: That can't be true, right？
But then, how is everyone even getting wheat for baking bread, or things like butter？

name: Hans
message: Sometimes I wonder, isn't it like the people in this village only ever eat fish......
Go outside
